results.title: Freestyle
results.creator_credit: Matt Morgan, David Lowe and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A man is murdered in a swimming pool at the beach. But did anyone actually witness the event? Cast features Mary-Lou Stewart, Roy Billing, Monique Spanbrook, Greg Blandy.

results.title: Code blue
results.creator_credit: Andrew O'Sullivan, Pascal Guilloux, Moira Moss and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A busy intersection in a large city. Everyone is going about their own business - waiting to cross the road, minding their children…A jay-walker is run over by a courier van. How fast can the city heal itself? ‘Code blue’ is a tightly directed and beautifully paced film which has screened at over 20 festivals throughout the world. The film’s blue tones help to create a tense and emotive ten minute journey through a fast city.

results.title: The Beat manifesto
results.creator_credit: Shilo McClean, Daniel Nettheim and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Hamish lives on a sheep farm in rural New South Wales, but he dreams of reading his poetry in a New York jazz club. After saving all his money for a ticket to ‘The Big Apple’, Hamish travels to Sydney where he meets aging Beat poet Bill Darcy. Bill offers to help Hamish, preparing him for his New York odyssey by teaching him the rules of the Beat lifestyle. Cast includes Steve Vidler as a cop.
Written by Tony McNamara, Daniel Nettheim and Mathew Schulz.

results.title: Universal Appliance Co.
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Michaeley O'Brien, Ruth Kleinhenz and Andrew Lancaster
results.brief_description: 1. An inventor finally gets a chance to mass produce his latest creation at the Universal Appliance Company factory. The production line runs smoothly until advertising and romance become distractions. Another multi-award winning production for director and sound designer Andrew Lancaster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: AFTRS, Michaeley O’Brien, Ruth Kleinhenz and Andrew Lancaster

results.title: Tran the man
results.creator_credit: Siobhan Hannan, Rowan Woods and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Ray Moss has been nicknamed “Tran” by his Asian workmates in his job as a security guard at a shopping centre in suburban Cabramatta. For Ray, the heat is on. His brother Donny and Uncle Jack have had their heroin business undercut by Asian-controlled competition in Cabramatta and Donny and Jack want Ray as their go-between. Cast features David Wenham as Ray/”Tran”.

results.title: The Space between the door and the floor
results.creator_credit: Andrew O'Sullivan, Pauline Chan and AFTRS
results.brief_description: He sits alone in his office waiting for the girl of his dreams. When she comes, he will see her approach in the space between the bottom of the door and the floor. He lights a cigarette and waits … In the space between the door and the floor there lies a sliver of light in a dark world of fantasy and desire.

results.title: Love at first sight
results.brief_description: An unhappy couple plan a special anniversary dinner but neither realises just how “special” the other has made it. A new husband discovers that he is just the latest in a long line of young men that his powerful older wife has seduced. A gigolo versus black widow battle of the sexes from the director of ‘Babe’ (1995). Cast features June Salter and Richard Moir. Original format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: Letters from Poland: Sydney, November, 1950
results.brief_description:
In Sydney in 1950 a young Polish woman waits for the arrival of Tadek, her prospective husband. Working as a night cleaner in a city office, she strikes up a casual friendship with the nightwatchman and waits for Tadek.
Cast features Martin Vaughan. Photography and editing by Martha Ansara.

results.title: Guru
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Pascal Guilloux and Safina Uberoi
results.brief_description: In the West, people fall in love and then get married. In India, people get married and then fall in love. But this is not India - this is Parramatta, in Sydney, Australia…A film celebrating cultural clashes amidst a wild and wonderful festival of colour. Original format 16 mm.
